channel.title: Urgent Help! AHH!
channel.description:
Okay not so urgent but whatever.
How do i link to a certain point in the page? You know how quote when you click on them it takes you to that exact post. How would i go about doing that on a normal website (not a forum)

item.title: Urgent Help! AHH!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Well, I think it works the same with ID instead of name outside an anchor.

Read full topic

item.title: Urgent Help! AHH!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I have no idea if other elements can be persuaded to listen to it, but even if they can you should use an anchor. That’s anchors job, after all.

Read full topic

item.title: Urgent Help! AHH!
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:3, topic:54791”]You put this in the tag for the component you want to go to

<... name="whatever" ...>

And you change the hyperlink

http://prefix.url.com/page.html#whatever [/quote]I was under the impression that this did only work for the anchor element (just tried for a paragraph and header elements with no success). Does it work with other elements?

Read full topic

item.title: Urgent Help! AHH!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Wow thank you for the fast response.

Read full topic

item.title: Urgent Help! AHH!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You put this in the tag for the component you want to go to

<... name="whatever" ...>

And you change the hyperlink

http://prefix.url.com/page.html#whatever

Read full topic

item.title: Urgent Help! AHH!
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

You use the anchor tag in html.

<a name="Header1"><h1>Header1</h1></a>
...
<a name="Header2"><h2>Header2</h1></a>

Those can be reached by accessing mypage.html#Header1 or mypage.html#Header2

Also, I’m moving this to the Web forum

Read full topic
